page.description: Returns TRUE if the string contains all the words (case insensitive).
page.syntax: Result_Flag as L = CONTAINSI(C String,C Words)

argument.name: String
argument.description: The target to examine, a character string containing words separated by space characters. Character

argument.name: Words
argument.description: Find_Words A character string containing words separated by space characters. The words to find in the target string. Character

page.discussion: CONTAINSI() returns .T. (TRUE) if all words in the Words string appear at least once in the String ; otherwise, it returns .F. (FALSE). Words found in memo fields will be highlighted. Find_Words can contain wildcard characters (* and ? ). Case insensitive.

section.title: Example
section.example: containsi("now is the time for all good men","now all is women") -> .F. because the word "women" does not appear in the first string containsi("now is the time for all good men","now all is ") -> .T.

section.description: This example indicates whether "blah" is found in a memo field named MemoField.
This example indicates whether "blah" is found in a RTF memo field named RtfField.
